paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.

paragraphs.content: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!
paragraphs.contentHtml: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O Lord of hosts!

paragraphs.content: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the LORD: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the Lord: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.

paragraphs.content: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O Lord of hosts, my King, and my God.

paragraphs.content: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.

paragraphs.content: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.

paragraphs.content: They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.

paragraphs.content: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.

paragraphs.content: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

paragraphs.content: O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
